answers.answer: Hi,Some typical symptoms of hypothyroidism include: weight gain, lethargy, brain fog, IBS, depression and lack of concentration. These would be more things that you could notice. Other things that can happen though from being untreated or undertreated that you wouldn't be able to see but a doctor could find include: diabetes, high blood pressure, and high cholesterol. There are probably plenty of other symptoms but these are more common.Chel

question: I have an adult nephew who was diagnosed at about1 years old with an inactive thyroid.  As a child, he took his synthroid medication.  As an adult, he refuses.  What are some of the physical signs or symptoms that would show?Thanks,Debbie
title: An adult with an inactive thyroid since birth
